snippet: As Crimea prepares for a vote on Sunday on whether to secede from Ukraine and join Russia, Tatars are plagued by a sense of foreboding and raw memories of Communist-era depredations.
abstract: Renewed Russian presence in Crimea has evoked memories of Communist-era depredations for Tatars, Turkic Muslim minority with deep roots in area; group, which was subjected to ethnic cleansing under Stalin during World War II, fears effects of new war on their small population.
lead_paragraph: As Crimea prepares for a vote on Sunday on whether to secede from Ukraine and join Russia, Tatars are plagued by a sense of foreboding and raw memories of Communist-era depredations.

headline.main: Mindful of Past, Many Tatars Fear a Russian Future
headline.print_headline: Crimean Tatars on Guard Against Joining Russia
